title: A post-Roe world? How would politics change
description: For nearly the last 50 years, Roe has provided stability to an uncomfortable and controversial issue. But if you get rid of Roe, every single state will need a position on fetus viability, weeks when you can/can’t have an abortion, parental notification, sonograms and possible exceptions. Chuck talks with Democratic strategist Adrienne Elrod and Republican strategist Susan del Percio.
author: nbcnews.podcasts@gmail.com (NBC News)
content:encoded: For nearly the last 50 years, Roe has provided stability to an uncomfortable and controversial issue. But if you get rid of Roe, every single state will need a position on fetus viability, weeks when you can/can’t have an abortion, parental notification, sonograms and possible exceptions. Chuck talks with Democratic strategist Adrienne Elrod and Republican strategist Susan del Percio.
itunes:title: A post-Roe world? How would politics change
itunes:author: NBC News
itunes:summary: Striking down Roe v. Wade – or even chipping away at it – could very well create political chaos.
itunes:subtitle: Striking down Roe v. Wade – or even chipping away at it – could very well create political chaos.
